Incident.Summary: Driver was stopped for traffic violation. Upon contact with the driver, the odor of an alcoholic beverage was detected. SFST's was conducted, and the driver was placed under arrest for DWI.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
In-Car camera and body worn camera operational.

Defendant: Jordan, Mia Symone

Date of Birth: 09/16/1999

Time of arrest: 0217 hours

Location: Westbound Route 228, in the area of Route 301, Waldorf, Charles County Maryland, 20602.

Maryland driver's license: MD10273716262

DUI#: 23-164

1st DUI

CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING

*Trained in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police.

*Trained in Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement through Charles County Sheriff's Office.

NARRATIVE/ VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1):

On 09/19/2023, at approximately 0152 hours, I, Tpr. Tripp #7333, with the Maryland State Police La Plata Barrack was on patrol in lane one of eastbound Route 228, in the area of Route 301, Waldorf, Charles County, Maryland 20602. I observed a gray Ford Fusion bearing Maryland registration 7BX8199, in lane one, stopped at a red light on northbound Route 5 at Route 301, Waldorf, Charles County, Maryland 20602. The driver standing out of the vehicle thrusting her hips, in a sexual provacative manner, in a low squatting position, on a controlled access highway. As I made a U-turn on Route 5, I observed the driver return to her vehicle and travel through the intersection of Route 301. I activated my emergency equipment and stopped the vehicle on westbound Route 228, in the area of Route 301, Waldorf, Charles County Maryland, 20602.

PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2):

Once I approached the vehicle, I immediately detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from the vehicle. I requested the driver for her driver’s license and registration card, which she displayed. I was able to identify the driver through her Maryland driver’s license as, Jordan, Mia Symone (A.A/F, DOB: 09/16/1999). While speaking with Jordan, I asked where she was coming from, she advised “Work”. I asked Jordan if she had consumed any alcoholic beverages, she advised “Yes”. I then asked what kind of alcoholic beverages did she consume, she advised “A glass of wine”. While speaking with Jordan, I observed her eyes to be glassy. I advised Jordan I needed her to perform Standardized Field Sobriety Test’s (SFST’s), which she agreed to take. As Jordan approached the front of her vehicle, I continued to detect the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from her breath and person.

PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3):

Cpl. Manning #6421 and Tpr. Fuller #7440 assisted with the traffic stop. While standing in front of Jordan's vehicle, I asked Jordan if she wears glasses or contacts, she advised “No”. I asked if there were any medical conditions that I should be aware of, Jordan advised “No”. I asked Jordan if she is a diabetic or have high blood pressure, she advised “No”. I asked Jordan if she had any head injuries or concussions, she advised “No”. I then asked Jordan if she was able to perform the Walk and Turn test (WAT) and the One Leg Stand test (OLS), she advised her weight will make it difficult. I then asked Jordan if she could see my pen displayed approximately 12 inches away from her eyes, she advised “Yes”.

HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS TEST: (4/6 clues observed).

The first test given was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus (HGN) test. The tip of my pen was used as the test's stimulus and held approximately 12 inches from Jordan's eyes. She was instructed to look straight ahead, keeping her head still while following and focusing on the tip of the stimulus with her eyes until told to stop. Her pupils were equal in size and showed equal tracking with no resting nystagmus. She was positioned in a manner to ensure the headlights of passing traffic would not interfere with the test results. Jordan was rude throughout the entire SFST’s process.

Jordan displayed equal pupil size, equal tracking and no resting nystagmus in both eyes.

Jordan displayed lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes.

Jordan displayed nystagmus at maximum deviation in both eyes.

Jordan did not display nystagmus prior to 45 degrees in both eyes.

VERTICAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS:

Jordan did not display vertical gaze nystagmus in both eyes.

WALK AND TURN: (7/8 clues observed).

Prior to Jordan performing the test, I explained and demonstrated how the test should be conducted. Jordan was instructed to place her right foot directly in front of her left foot and touch heel to toe. She was instructed and demonstrated to place her hands flat at her sides and to remain in that position until told to begin. She was advised to take nine (9) steps on a straight-line touching heel to toe on every step. She was instructed to keep her hands flat at her sides, keep her eyes focused on her feet, and to count every step aloud. On the ninth step, Jordan was explained and demonstrated to keep her lead foot on the line, and to take a series of small steps around with her rear foot to turn completely around. Jordan was again explained and demonstrated the second series of nine (9) steps were to be performed identical to the first series. She was instructed once she began the test she was not to stop walking until the test was completed, keep her hands down by her sides, look down at her feet, and count each step out loud. Jordan advised she understood the test before beginning. Jordan advised she will complete this test poorly due to her weight.

Jordan was barefoot for this test.

Jordan could not keep her balance before beginning the test.

Jordan raised her arms on her first and second step, on her first set of nine steps.

Jordan missed heel-to-toe step on her first and second step, on her first set of nine steps.

Jordan stepped off-line on her first and second step, on her first set of nine steps.

Jordan stopped after the second step.

Jordan restarted the test after the first two steps.

Jordan missed heel-to-toe steps on all nine of her steps, on her second set of nine steps.

Jordan stepped off-line on all nine of her steps, on her second set of nine steps.

Jordan took ten steps instead of nine as instructed.

Jordan stopped after the tenth step, on her second set of nine steps.

Jordan performed an improper turn by not taking a series of small steps to turn around as instructed. 

Jordan stepped off-line on all nine steps, on her third set of nine steps.

Jordan missed heel-to-toe on all nine steps, on her third set of nine steps.

ONE LEG STAND: (2/4 clues observed/Refusal)

Prior to Jordan performing the test, I explained and demonstrated how the test should be performed. She was instructed to stand with her heels together and hands down by her sides while the instructions were given. When instructed to start, she was to raise the foot of her choice off of the ground approximately 6 inches. While her leg was raised, she was to keep her leg straight, watch her raised foot, and to count out loud by thousands (one thousand-one, one thousand-two) and to continue the test until told to stop. Jordan advised she understood the test.

Jordan raised her right foot for this test.

0-10 seconds

Jordan placed her foot down at two and ten seconds.

Jordan swayed at two and ten seconds.

Jordan refused to continue the test after ten seconds.

Jordan was offered to take the Preliminary Breath Test (PBT) and refused to take the test.

Arrest:

-Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from her breath and person.

-Glassy eyes.

-Admission to drinking alcoholic beverage.

-Clues displayed from the Standardized Field Sobriety Test.

Jordan was placed under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol at 0217 hours. The DR-15 Advise of Rights was read to Jordan, and she agreed to take the Intoximeter Test at 0237 hours. Jordan was then transported to the Maryland State Police La Plata Barrack for further processing. The Intoximeter test was administered by Cpl. Manning at 0315 hours. Jordan's results were .07 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath.

Jordan received the following citations:

TA-21-902(b1i) Driving while impaired by alcohol.

TA-21-901.1(b) Negligent driving.

TA-21-901.1(a) Reckless driving.

TA-21-201(a1) Driver fail to obey traffic control device instructions.

TA-21-1407 Standing on authority highway when prohibited.

Jordan was released to a valid, sober driver.

All events occurred in Charles County, Maryland.

Case closed.
